commit_message:
Using bootable if set for disk

If nailgun will send as bootable flag for disk we have to use this
disk and place '/boot' on it

Change-Id: I881d9fd4bb378dec78fd86aff0c314c910525110
Closes-bug: 1567450
(cherry picked from commit 5a56d6a4e8eaeb354f50772614bc947264c91056)

commit_message:
Add bootable disk node flag

Adding this flag to specified disk allows user to choose bootable disk
from Fuel UI and CLi.

This change is very important for deployments with multipath connected
block devices. Mainly, it is because, order of disks in UI can change
easly in this case, so we need introduce to user a possibility to
choose bootable disk explicitly.
(cherry picked from commit 2df11392ab6f28d828d48f2151f4903da888d216)
Partial-Bug: #1567450

Change-Id: I22ffe9104d2ec5a6598d496691fffa0087111070
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/55/309055/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: bootable_disk = objects.NodeAttributes.bootable_disk(node) if bootable_disk: serialized_node['ks_meta']['bootable_disk'] = bootable_disk

subject: Fix usages view on project/overview page
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-06 09:58:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila-ui/commit/cf1c7ac030b86d45749eddeb9853b7be382929ce', 'message': "Fix usages view on project/overview page

Currently, Manila UI adds its own HTML template to project/overview
page for quota limits. It contains info for other projects.
It is fragile and redundant.

Therefore, delete that template, reusing original Horizon's one that
is flexible enough to display limits for any project.

Extend one of Horizon's view python-classes with Manila data that
will be picked up by HTML template. It is safe to do the same for
other Horizon plugins too.

commit_message:
Fix usages view on project/overview page

Currently, Manila UI adds its own HTML template to project/overview
page for quota limits. It contains info for other projects.
It is fragile and redundant.

Therefore, delete that template, reusing original Horizon's one that
is flexible enough to display limits for any project.

Extend one of Horizon's view python-classes with Manila data that
will be picked up by HTML template. It is safe to do the same for
other Horizon plugins too.

Change-Id: I2e4cad33326c486352f340918395d4ee85ebe8e1
Closes-Bug: #1576791

commit_message:
Multi Cloud Capable Murano - Python Bindings EC2

The blueprint is to add python bindings to support EC2

Targets bp:https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/multi-cloud-capable-murano-ec2-driver-spec

Change-Id: Iefff2046e2796ef8d132b0113834d515741c4051
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-specs refs/changes/18/281018/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ===================================== Multi Cloud Support - Driver Spec EC2 ===================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/multi-cloud-capable-murano-ec2-driver-spec Introduction paragraph -- The blueprint is to add driver support for Amazon EC2 Problem description =================== In order to make murano multi cloud capable, we need drivers to talk to the APIs of various cloud management platforms.As of today murano can orchestrate low level cloud resources only on an Openstack Cloud Management Platform using Heat Orchestration Engine APIs (HOT Templates). This functionality is baked into the Murano Core Library instead of as plugin making it hard to provide a flexibility of choosing various drivers. As part of this release drivers will be implemented as plugins which the Core MuranoPL library can invoke. This document talks about plugin for Amazon EC2.These drivers will be bundled with the murano code but will not be installed by default as part of the murano installation. To reduce the dependency of going through openstack approval process for packages required to support these cloud drivers the drivers will have to be installed separately by the cloud administrators via pip install or by running the setup.py scripts provided with the drivers. Proposed change =============== Introducing drivers to talk to the API of Amazon EC2 as plugin. Alternatives ------------ Extending Murano Core library to include these features Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Versioning impact ----------------- <TBD> Other end user impact --------------------- <TBD> Deployer impact --------------- <TBD> Developer impact ---------------- <TBD> Murano-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- None Implementation ============== Temporary security credentials to be provided to support Amazon drivers. Temporary credentials can be used by passing token argument to the driver constructor in addition to the access and secret key. In this case token represents a temporary session token, access key represents temporary access key and secret key represents a temporary secret key. * ``cls = get_driver(Provider.EC2)`` driver = cls('temporary access key', 'temporary secret key',token='temporary session token', region="us-west-1") The APIs exposed by the driver to be implemented would be these: * ``createNode(name, image, size, auth, location)`` To create a new EC2 node. The instance will be started automatically. The arguments required in order to create a node successfully are : - name = String with a name for this new node - image = OS image to boot on node. - size = size of resources allocated to this node - auth = Initial authentication information for the node - location = Node Location, which data center to create a node in The optional arguments to this function can be - mincount = Minimum number of instances to launch - maxcount = Maximum number of instances to launch - security_groups = a list of names of security groups to assign to this node. - metadata = key value meta data to associate with the node. - subnet - the subnet to launch the instance into Return value of this function is the newly created node. * ``createSecurityGroup(name, description, vpc_id)`` To create a new security group the arguments requireed in order to create a security group are: - name = Unique name for the security group to create. - description = Human readable description of a security group - vpc_id = Optional Identifier for VPC Networks Return Type: dict * ``deleteSecurityGroup(name)`` Name of the security group which needs to be deleted. Return Type:bool * ``deleteSecurityGroupById(group_id)`` Deletes a security group using the group ID Return Type:bool * ``deployNode(node)`` Create a new node and start deployment. In order to be able to SSH into created node, access credentials are required.If create_node was successful but later we have errors like SSH Failing or timing out, DeploymentException will be seen The arguments passed to this function are: - deploy = Deployment to run once machine is online and available to SSH - auth = Initial Authentication information for the node (optional) - timeout = How many seconds to wait before timing out - max_tries = How many times to retry if a deployment fails before giving up. Other optional parameters are: ssh_username = Optional * ``destroyNode(node)`` Destroy node by passing in the node object. * ``rebootNode(node)`` Reboot the node by passing in the Node object. * ``listNodes()`` returns list of Node objects. * ``startNode(node)`` start the node by passing in the node object * ``listImages()`` List all Images on a provider * ``copyImage()`` Copy an Amazon Machine Image from the specified source region to the current region. * ``createImage()`` Create an Amazon Machine Image based off of an EBS-backed instance. * ``deleteImage(image)`` Deletes an image at Amazon given a NodeImage object * ``createVolume()`` To create a new volume * ``create_volume_snapshot(volume)`` create snapshots from volume * ``allocateAddress()`` allocate a new Elastic IP address. * ``releaseAddress()`` Release an elastic IP address * ``allocateAddressWthNode()`` Associate an Elastic IP address with a particular node * ``createKeypair(name)`` Create a new keypair with the given name. The name should be unique, else InvalidKeyPair exception is raised. * ``deleteKeypair()`` Deletes a keypair by name * ``listAvailabilityZones()`` Returns a list of Availability zone instances for the current region < There are more APIs, <TBD> what all do we plan to support and how?> Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Ruchika Other contributors: <TBD> Work Items ---------- * Implement driver * Implement unit tests * Integration tests with Murano <TBD about other work items> Dependencies ============ Testing ======= * Unit Tests * Integration Tests Documentation Impact ==================== Add new documents in standard documents location References ========== * https://libcloud.apache.org/

commit_message:
Multi Cloud Capable Murano Core Library

This specification covers enhancements to Murano core library to deploy
applications across different clouds, based on the cloud configuration
and the policies by cloud operator and/or by end user through user interface.

Targets bp: multi-cloud-capable-murano-core-library

Change-Id: Ieb20606064510912fd06915e18a7baea7639f0bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-specs refs/changes/92/280992/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================= Multi-cloud capable murano core library ======================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/multi-cloud-capable-murano-core-library Add support for deploying multi-cloud applications using Murano. Problem description =================== Today murano can deploy applications only on Openstack using HEAT This specification covers enhancements to Murano core library to deploy applications across different clouds, based on the cloud configuration and the policies by cloud operator and/or by end user through user interface. Murano is shipped with number of classes that represent common infrastructure entities like Instance, Network etc. Those classes together are known as Murano Core Library and are used by most applications to interact with the underlying cloud. Currently those classes were written with only OpenStack in mind and their implementation mostly relies on OpenStack Heat API to create OpenStack resources. That makes it not sufficient for other clouds where there is no such API available and entities not always have the same properties as they have in OpenStack. Murano should include support for the following clouds: * OpenStack (native) * VMWare * Amazon (EC2) Proposed change =============== As part of multi-cloud support, following enhancements are required to the core library: * Classes describing hierarchy of the abstract cloud resources and actual implementations with cloud-specific features * Concrete class implementations for cloud specific networking and security groups * Policy based dependency injection for the instance classes Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- Environment data model should carry information about the Cloud provider and also the reference for cloud credentials. Cloud provider information will be used to determine the Concrete classes during dependency injection. REST API impact --------------- API related to environment shall now have additional fields indicating the cloud and contain the indentity management information for cloud access Versioning impact ----------------- TBD(Do we need to support versions below N? If yes then back-porting efforts?) Other end user impact --------------------- TBD(UI and API shall be covered by identity management spec) Deployer impact --------------- TBD (Mostly none) Developer impact ---------------- MuranoPL enhancements to support multi cloud options to the application developers eg: Application developers might want cloud specific customizations in the application package Murano-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- * Additional control (drop box with region names) is added to environment configuration form. * Dashboard need to correctly handle situation when murano is present only in some of available regions. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: TBD Work Items ---------- Multi-Cloud Core library classes ```````````````````````````````` murano-engine needs to be aware of the cloud on which application should run When deploying environment. We need to design new hierarchy of classes in core library for the abstract cloud resources (e.g. vm, image) and actual implementations for each cloud with cloud-specific features backed by Python-based plugins for each cloud with actual lifecycle for this resources. There needs to be a base Cloud class, and Cloud specific classes for AWS, Openstack,Vmware etc. This classes consist of the cloud credentials, and later can be enhanced to contain cloud schemes such as bursting, balancing in future. Multi-Cloud Instance classes ```````````````````````````` We also need cloud specific Instance classes which derive from the base Instance class and then have OS specific classes too +------------+ | Instance | +------------+ | | +------------+ | | | | | | +-----+------+ +----------^ | ^------------+ | | | +------+-----+ +-----+-------+ +------+---------+ | | | | | | | AwsInstance| | NovaInstance| | VmwareInstance | | | | | | | | | | | | | +------------+ +-------------+ +----------------+ +--------^ ^------+ | | +------+------+ +--------+---+ | | | | | Linux | | Windows | | Instance | | Instance | | | | | +-------------+ +------------+ Properties and methods that are common to all (or most) clouds need to be extracted into top-level interfaces and let cloud-specific classes to implement those interfaces. New classes will require new native APIs to talk to different cloud platforms * Python classes or functions that will expose low-level cloud functions to MuranoPL. API methods should provide ability to perform basic CRUD operations on target cloud. Those APIs should be as small and flexible as possible while the most of orchestration and logic should be put into MuranoPL YAML classes. Extending the Environment ````````````````````````` Environment shall store the information about the cloud scheme, where the application needs to be deployed CloudScheme: Contract: $.class(sys:CloudSchme) Usage: Runtime * Choose the appropriate Cloud specific Instance class based on Cloud provider * Ability to inject the Cloud specific Networking class * generateSecurityGroupManager() API, shall create and initialize the concrete security group manager Environment shall also contain the list of credential object names credentials: Contract: [$.string().notNull()] TODO: Should the credentials be inside the CloudScheme ? Deploying instances on Openstack natively ````````````````````````````````````````` Currently Murano relies on HEAT to deploy the instances. As part of core library enhancements, native deployment capability needs to be added. A new class to represent the instances for NovaInstance.yaml shall be written and it will bypass HEAT and directly deploy using NOVA Following line in Environment.yaml instantiates the HEAT stack object - $this.stack: new(sys:HeatStack, name => 'murano-' + $generatedEnvironmentName, description => $stackDescriptionFormat.format($.name, $.id())) Depending on the choice of cloud and choice of HEAT or directly deploying using NOVA, multi-cloud instance object needs to be created. Deploying instances on other clouds ``````````````````````````````````` Cloud specific Instance classes shall have tighter integration with the cloud drivers and contain the intelligence to invoke cloud specific CRUD API These instances are injected with the cloud object,Credentials and other policies specific to the cloud. Cloud specific Resources ```````````````````````` There is a need to define concrete classes to represent the networking and storage needs of the application instances. Some of the new network classes are listed below Network.yaml - AWSNetwork.yaml* - VmwareNetwork.yaml* Murano has the concept of SecurityGroup manager classes which can be leveraged SecurityGroupManager.yaml - AwsSecurityGroupManager.yaml - NeutronSecurityGroupManager.yaml NOTE: VMware vCenter does not have any concept of security groups. Need to explore alternatives here. Dependency Injection mechanism `````````````````````````````` Dependency injection mechanism needs to be developed that will make Murano automatically inject best possible implementation for any requested interface and policy rules. eg: Assuming wordpress application to be deployed on AWS, AWSInstance is created and Dependency injection will dynamically inject the concrete objects of the instance such as AWSNetwork and EC2SecurityGroup etc. MuranoPL enhancements ````````````````````` MuranoPL needs improvements so that it is possible to put additional metadata on classes (methods, properties) to express their capabilities. This mechanism can be used to express other useful metadata as well like UI hints, property groups, ACL hints etc. so it need to be extensible enough. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= We should test application deployment on multiple clouds. * Simple applications * Complex multi-tier applications * Application deployment on Openstack natively using NOVA(without being dependent on HEAT) Documentation Impact ==================== * Enhancements to the Murano core needs to be documented in the Developer guide * Changes made to Environment config UI/CLI need to be documented in user's guide. References ========== 1. TBD - Identity management spec (multi-cloud) 2. TBD - Multi-cloud drivers

commit_message:
Murano Multicloud capable identity management

Adds Identity management for various cloud other than OpenStack. To
store the cloud and Instance credentials and other configurations.
This is required to support the Murano Multi-cloud support.

Targets bp: multi-cloud-capable-murano-identity-management

Change-Id: Iaf345e7b9491866a420bd7ef0fa794f1cbf2a8d0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-specs refs/changes/90/280990/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =============================== Multi-Cloud Identity Management =============================== URL of launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/multi-cloud-capable-murano-identity-management Adds Identity management for various cloud other than OpenStack. To store the cloud and Instance credentials and other configurations. This is required to support the Murano Multi-cloud support. Problem description =================== Currently, there is no way to store the credentials and other cloud details in the Murano for multi-cloud deployment. This feature introduces Identity management which can be used to store and retrieve the CMP details. Proposed change =============== In order to fulfill this functionality, two new entity can be introduced in the MURANO database. It is the Cloud and Instance Credentials, which contains the specification and credential about the cloud and the instance. Which will be used for accessing and deploying an instance in different cloud apart from MURANO. These can be created, deleted, modified and customized by the users. In fact, Cloud would be a part of the environment and Instance credential would used for customizing the Instance. For instance, if user wants to deploy an instance he can select the Cloud credentials in the environment and add the Applications. Alternatives ------------ TBD Data model impact ----------------- A Cloud Credentials entity will be introduced in the MURANO object model. This would be stored in the database, the inclusion of Cloud Credentials services and the extension of the API. The Cloud Credentials can consist of below fields: cloud_credential :- murano:property(cloud_credential, "id", ID) murano:property(cloud_credential, "name", varchar) murano:property(cloud_credential, "tenant_id", varchar) murano:property(cloud_credential, "cloud_type", varchar) murano:property(cloud_credential, "user", varchar) murano:property(cloud_credential, "key", varchar) murano:property(cloud_credential, "private_key", varchar) murano:property(cloud_credential, "cloud_endpoint", varchar) murano:property(cloud_credential, "options", json) A Cloud Instance Credentials entity will be introduced in the MURANO object model. This would be stored in the database, the inclusion of Cloud Instance Credentials services and the extension of the API. The Cloud Credentials can consist of below fields: cloud_instance_credentials :- murano:property(cloud_credential, "id", ID) murano:property(cloud_credential, "name", varchar) murano:property(cloud_credential, "tenant_id", varchar) murano:property(cloud_credential, "user", varchar) murano:property(cloud_credential, "password", varchar) murano:property(cloud_credential, "key_pair", varchar) both the new models would be inherited from **TimestampMixin**. REST API impact --------------- The inclusion of the cloud credentials and cloud instance credentials entity will imply the extension of the API for creation, deletion, updating and retrieving . Cloud credentials API endpoint `````````````````````````````` **POST /cloudcredential** *Request* +--------+----------------------------------+---------------------------------+ | Method | URI | Description | +========+==================================+=================================+ | POST | /cloudcredential | Creates new cloud credentials | +--------+----------------------------------+---------------------------------+ :: { "tenant_id" : "tenant_id", "name" : "cc_name", "cloud_type" : "cloud_type", "user" : "user_name", "key" : "provided_key", "private_key": "private_key, "cloud_url" : "cloud_endpoint_url", "options" : { "data_center" : "value1", "project" : "value2" } } *Response* +----------------+-------------------------------------+ | Code | Description | +================+=====================================+ | 200 | Cloud information are stored | +----------------+-------------------------------------+ :: { "id": "cloud_cred_id" } **DELETE /cloudcredential/<cloud_cred_id>** *Request* +-----------+-----------------------------------+-----------------------------+ | Method | URI | Description | +===========+===================================+=============================+ | DELETE | /cloudcredential/<cloud_cred_id> | Delete the cloud credential | | | | details. | +-----------+-----------------------------------+-----------------------------+ *Parameters:* * `cloud_cred_id` - cloud credential id, required *Response* +----------------+-----------------------------------------+ | Code | Description | +================+=========================================+ | 200 | Successfully deleted cloud credential | +----------------+-----------------------------------------+ **GET /cloudcredential/<cloud_cred_id>** *Request* +--------+------------------------------------+-------------------------------+ | Method | URI | Description | +========+====================================+===============================+ | GET | /cloudcredential/<cloud_cred_id> | Get the information about the | | | | cloud credential | +--------+------------------------------------+-------------------------------+ *Parameters:* * `cloud_cred_id` - cloud credential id, if not provided would return all the cloud credentials of the tenant. *Response* +----------------+----------------------------+ | Code | Description | +================+============================+ | 200 | Action was executed | +----------------+----------------------------+ :: { "id" : "00000000000000000000000001", "tenant_id" : "tenant_id", "name" : "cc_name", "cloud_type" : "cloud_type", "user" : "user_name", "key" : "provided_key", "private_key": "private_key, "cloud_url" : "cloud_endpoint_url", "options" : { "data_center" : "value1", "project" : "value2" }, "created": "2016-02-10T09:12:51", "updated": "2016-02-10T09:12:51", } Instance credentials API endpoint ````````````````````````````````` **POST /instancecredential** *Request* +--------+------------------------------+-------------------------------------+ | Method | URI | Description | +========+==============================+=====================================+ | POST | /instancecredential | Creates new instance credentials | +--------+------------------------------+-------------------------------------+ :: { "tenant_id" : "tenant_id", "name" : "instance_name", "user" : "user_name", "password" : "password", "private_key": "private_key", } *Response* +----------------+-------------------------------------+ | Code | Description | +================+=====================================+ | 200 | Cloud information are stored | +----------------+-------------------------------------+ :: { "id": "inst_cred_id" } **DELETE /instancecredential/<inst_cred_id>** *Request* +-----------+------------------------------------+----------------------------+ | Method | URI | Description | +===========+====================================+============================+ | DELETE | /instancecredential/<inst_cred_id> | Delete the instance | | | | credential details. | +-----------+------------------------------------+----------------------------+ *Parameters:* * `inst_cred_id` - cloud credential id, required *Response* +----------------+-----------------------------------------+ | Code | Description | +================+=========================================+ | 200 | Successfully deleted cloud credential | +----------------+-----------------------------------------+ **GET /instancecredential/<inst_cred_id>** *Request* +--------+------------------------------------+-------------------------------+ | Method | URI | Description | +========+====================================+===============================+ | GET | /instancecredential/<inst_cred_id> | Get the information about the | | | | instance credential | +--------+------------------------------------+-------------------------------+ *Parameters:* * `inst_cred_id` - cloud credential id, if not provided would return all the cloud credentials of the tenant. *Response* +----------------+----------------------------+ | Code | Description | +================+============================+ | 200 | Action was executed | +----------------+----------------------------+ :: { "id" : "00000000000000000000000001", "tenant_id" : "tenant_id", "name" : "cc_name", "user" : "user_name", "key" : "provided_key", "private_key": "private_key", "created" : "2016-02-10T09:12:51", "updated" : "2016-02-10T09:12:51", } Versioning impact ----------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- As well as a change in the API to include these new entity, the python-muranoclient will be changed for including the cloud credential and instance credentials operations. * cloud-credential-create Create a cloud credential. * cloud-credential-delete Delete a cloud credential. * cloud-credential-list List the cloud credentials. * cloud-credential-show show the cloud credential. * instance-credential-create Create an instance credential . * instance-credential-delete Delete an instance credential. * instance-credential-list List the instance credentials. * instance-credential-show show the instance credential. * environment-create : would need to be enhanced for adding the cloud credential. Deployer impact --------------- TBD Developer impact ---------------- TBD Murano-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- * Under Murano Manage a New option would be provided for Credentials and the following details would be accepted. - Cloud Credentials. - Instance Credentials. - Environment would have drop down for selecting the Cloud Credential. - Instance launch Dynamic UI would have drop down for selecting the instance credential. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Govardhana Sankanna Work Items ---------- #. Create database migration and model code to work with new table. - db/models.py would be modified for database place holder. - cloud_credential - instance_credential - cloud_cred_to_env : mapper table to environment. - instance_cred_to_instance : mapper table to environment. - db/service : db service for cloud and instance credentials would be introduced. - cloud_credentials.py - instance_credentials.py #. Create API endpoint to CRUD on URL /cloudcredential and /instancecredential. - cloud_credentials.py : - instance_credentials.py: - router.py #. While processing the environment create post, we need to embed the cloud credentials in the environment description (TBD). It would be access to the murano engine / instance can access it. #. Improve python-muranoclient with support for new endpoints. - muranoclient/shell.py : Would be enhanced for CLI for cloud-credential and instance-credential. - muranoclient/v1/cloud_credential.py : new file for API interaction. - muranoclient/v1/instance_credential.py : new file for API interaction. - muranoclient/v1/environments.py : to include the cloud credential details. #. Provide the same capabilities in Murano dashboard. TODO Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= - CRUD operation for both the new endpoints. - Extending the UT cases. Documentation Impact ==================== - API's for cloud credential and instance credential should be documented. - murano client for cloud and instance credential should be documented. - update the environment-create should be doucmented. - Instance cloud credential access. #TBD(Govardhan) References ========== TBD

commit_message:
Set proper public_endpoint in ironic.conf

Ironic requires correct public endpoint url set in config to avoid issues with
HTTPS links to resources.

Change-Id: I742f03b706e6a1fb4fbdc698032151b53d9adb72
Closes-bug: #1571610
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/65/314565/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $public_protocol = get_ssl_property($ssl_hash, {}, 'ironic', 'public', 'protocol', 'http') $public_address = get_ssl_property($ssl_hash, {}, 'ironic', 'public', 'hostname', $public_vip) ironic_config { 'api/public_endpoint': value => "${public_protocol}://${public_address}:6385"; }

commit_message:
Replace django DoesNotExist exception with custom devops exception
and provide full information

Change-Id: Ib6dff38d0973bf6a9ff3f80132ded342f13e276f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-devops refs/changes/80/304680/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from devops.error import DevopsObjNotFound def __repr__(self): return 'Environment(name={name})'.format(name=self.name) try: return self.addresspool_set.get(**kwargs) except AddressPool.DoesNotExist: raise DevopsObjNotFound(AddressPool, **kwargs) try: return self.group_set.get(**kwargs) except Group.DoesNotExist: raise DevopsObjNotFound(Group, **kwargs) try: return cls.objects.get(*args, **kwargs) except Environment.DoesNotExist: raise DevopsObjNotFound(Environment, *args, **kwargs) try: return Node.objects.get(*args, group__environment=self, **kwargs) except Node.DoesNotExist: raise DevopsObjNotFound(Node, *args, **kwargs)
deleted_lines: return self.addresspool_set.get(**kwargs) return self.group_set.get(**kwargs) return cls.objects.get(*args, **kwargs) return Node.objects.get(*args, group__environment=self, **kwargs)

commit_message:
All API errors are now in json

1. It is uniform.
2. It prevents XSS via injecting scripts into error messages.

Change-Id: I5ec2d0b7423cc7f2be5bfa12ec3f3b16e9b59e19
Closes-Bug: #1583602

added_lines: http_error.data = json_resp({'message': http_error.data}) http_error.data = json_resp({'message': http_error.data}) web.header('Content-Type', 'application/json')

commit_message:
Build late artifacts without rebuilding fuel packages

Implement flag PATCHING_CI, which is equal 0, means:
  * patching feature is disabled.

If PATCHING_CI=1, then:

1) Build iso with BUILD_PACKAGES=0:
   late packages (fuel-bootstrap-image, fuel-docker-images)
   should be always build since they are depend on the first
   level artifacts (packages);
2) Make sure the release version of bootstrap and
   docker packages is increasing.
    We need to be sure that packages (in packages-late target):
     - fuel-bootstrap-image
     - fuel-docker-images
    will increase their release numbers by 1 continuously
    in order to be able to ship them in updates repositories.

Related-bug: #1559117

Change-Id: Ie875f0e53bb478376703f2f2cb9b9f7d77c7c196

added_lines: # Usage: # (eval (inc_rpm_package_release,package_name)) # If we are running patching then increment package release number by 1 # else - just assign release number 1 define inc_rpm_package_release $(BUILD_DIR)/packages/sources/$1/version: SANDBOX:=$(BUILD_DIR)/packages/rpm/SANDBOX/buildd $(BUILD_DIR)/packages/sources/$1/version: $(BUILD_DIR)/packages/rpm/buildd.tar.gz $(BUILD_DIR)/packages/sources/$1/version: mkdir -p $$(@D) echo -e "RELEASE=\c" > $$@.tmp ifeq ($(PATCHING_CI),1) bash -c "set -o pipefail && \ yum -c $$(SANDBOX)/etc/yum.conf --installroot=$$(SANDBOX) info $1 | grep Release | tr -d ' ' | cut -d':' -f2 | xargs -I{} expr {} + 1 >> $$@.tmp" else echo "1" >> $$@.tmp endif mv $$@.tmp $$@ endef$(BUILD_DIR)/packages/rpm/$1.done: $(BUILD_DIR)/packages/sources/$1/version $(BUILD_DIR)/packages/sources/fuel-docker-images/version \ sudo cp $(SPECFILE) $(SANDBOX)/tmp sudo chroot $(SANDBOX) rpmbuild --nodeps --define "_topdir /tmp" \ --define "release `awk -F'=' '/RELEASE/ {print $$2}' $(BUILD_DIR)/packages/sources/fuel-docker-images/version`" \ -ba /tmp/fuel-docker-images.spec$(eval $(call inc_rpm_package_release,fuel-bootstrap-image)) $(eval $(call inc_rpm_package_release,fuel-target-centos-images$(CENTOS_RELEASE))) $(eval $(call inc_rpm_package_release,fuel-docker-images))

commit_message:
Restart dsnmasq on any network subnet change

When a new subnet is added to a network, the network cache
is updated with the list of subnets regardless of which ones
have DHCP enabled. This changes the index order of the subnet
list which means that the tags used for each subnet change.

This means we must restart the process because the opts file
will be using different tags than the process args. This patch
implements that change. It also sorts the subnets on the RPC
side so the agent indexes don't change if subnets aren't
added/deleted.

The previous logic was only restarting the process when DHCP
enabled subnets changed, which meant that adding a DHCP disabled
subnet would break the association between the opts file tags and
the process arg tags, which led to the reported bug.

Closes-Bug: #1581918
Change-Id: If1452c0e8fe95eb94cd78c7a05b57aead75662b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/15/316615/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Providing an option to disable configure_user in Keystone

Currently configure_user and configure_user_role parameters are set to true. There should be an option to configure the parameter with appropriate values.

For Example, If we are using Keystone User entries from LDAP, We can't create/update the user.

Change-Id: I61e866c2ea0c1eac9c68d4fedef987fd953bad21
Closes-Bug: #1583920

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-19 12:23:46.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/ceph_hooks.py', 'templates/ceph.conf'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd/commit/813500053e4e8456c2e5f4d9665ba9dd58bc38af', 'message': "Limit OSD object name lengths for Jewel + ext4

As of the Ceph Jewel release, certain limitations apply to

must be configured to limit object name length:

  osd max object name len = 256
  osd max object namespace len = 64

This may cause problems storing objects with long names via
the ceph-radosgw charm or for direct users of RADOS.

this.

Change-Id: I26f1d8a6f9560b307929f294d2d637c92986cf41
Closes-Bug: 1580320

(cherry picked from commit 53d09832e59b3cb268f7ae2d72335b7780905c7b)
"}]
commit_message:
Limit OSD object name lengths for Jewel + ext4

As of the Ceph Jewel release, certain limitations apply to
OSD object name lengths: specifically if ext4 is in use for
block devices or a directory based OSD is configured, OSD's
must be configured to limit object name length:

  osd max object name len = 256
  osd max object namespace len = 64

This may cause problems storing objects with long names via
the ceph-radosgw charm or for direct users of RADOS.

Also ensure that ceph.conf as a final newline as ceph requires
this.

Change-Id: I26f1d8a6f9560b307929f294d2d637c92986cf41
Closes-Bug: 1580320
Closes-Bug: 1578403
(cherry picked from commit 53d09832e59b3cb268f7ae2d72335b7780905c7b)

commit_message:
Drop ironic-lib dependency

This patch is copying the unlink_without_raise() method from the
ironic-lib to the fuel-agent repository. The ironic-lib is not a library
that should be considered stable to be used by projects outside the
Ironic umbrella.

Change-Id: I746fbb0dd18b59739e753282bf6ded6690df5230
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-agent refs/changes/24/318724/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Convert TCP/UDP port numbers to protocol names

OVN expects 'tcp' and 'udp' and not the protocol number in its rules.
Previously, rules that specified the protocol number were dropped and not
applied to the backend.

pointed out on previous by Richard Theis.

Change-Id: I15aec4ccd68a334e9a32fcc5233a59174ff92831

commit_message:
scenario001: run Gnocchi tempest tests

Install & Run Gnocchi Tempest tests.

Change-Id: I6a626524cb2b4e938c273791c37bbaa7f1d714ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/73/308473/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $ipv6 = false # gnocchi is not packaged in Ubuntu Cloud Archive # https://bugs.launchpad.net/cloud-archive/+bug/1535740 $gnocchi_enabled = false $ipv6 = true $gnocchi_enabled = false gnocchi => $gnocchi_enabled,

subject: Only attempt to inject files if the injection disk exists
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-27 16:02:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5c1e4329140b5de988df0abec580d5efa2d78519', 'message': 'Only attempt to inject files if the injection disk exists

_inject_data was checking for the existence of the image to inject
into. However, the only caller of _inject_data has just created that
image. We move the _inject_data call up to where the image is created,
and pass the existing image object in directly. We modify _inject_data
to remove the existence check as, bar a delete race which was present
anyway, we know it exists.

As a bonus, this removes the last user of check_image_exists outside
imagebackend. This api is problematic as it almost always (including
this case) points to a race condition. The remaining callers can be
dealt with within a single module.

Change-Id: Icb926e64151048c6ce8353de604417d5d79858e4
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-01 11:30:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d0340d59de30d52bd1f381a3ea34b20477f74152', 'message': 'Only attempt to inject files if the injection disk exists

commit_message:
Only attempt to inject files if the injection disk exists

_inject_data was checking for the existence of the image to inject
into. However, the only caller of _inject_data has just created that
image. We move the _inject_data call up to where the image is created,
and pass the existing image object in directly. We modify _inject_data
to remove the existence check as, bar a delete race which was present
anyway, we know it exists.

Change-Id: Icb926e64151048c6ce8353de604417d5d79858e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/72/250872/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.drvr._inject_data(image_backend, **driver_params) 'files': None
deleted_lines: def check_image_exists(self): if self.path == '/fail/path': return False return True self.drvr._inject_data(**driver_params) 'files': None, 'suffix': ''

subject: make acl match recognize ipv6 icmp alias and number
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-22 08:41:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/bf1b01bbf36972881d115b1ef5ae0e436ba189a7', 'message': 'unify security group rule ICMPv6 protocol options

Current code have different behaviors for three different ICMPv6
protocol options when creating a security group rule.

For "icmpv6" and "ipv6-icmp" options, it will add a new record with
"output == PORT_ID && ip6",
and for "icmp" option, it will add a new record with
"output == PORT_ID && ip6 && icmp6".

The different result will cause potential security risk when using
"icmpv6" and "ipv6-icmp" options to create a security group rule
for ICMPv6 Protocol.

This patch will fix this.

Closes-Bug: #1573465
Change-Id: I8dad569262162b03b79699a13e028c2fc8244c92
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-23 03:51:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/969161514cb20af3cc11d9561d8519721b50e32c', 'message': 'unify security group rule ICMPv6 protocol options

Current code have different behaviors for three different ICMPv6
protocol options when creating a security group rule.

For "icmpv6" and "ipv6-icmp" options, it will add a new record with
"output == PORT_ID && ip6",
and for "icmp" option, it will add a new record with
"output == PORT_ID && ip6 && icmp6".

The different result will cause potential security risk when using
"icmpv6" and "ipv6-icmp" options to create a security group rule
for ICMPv6 Protocol.

This patch will fix this.

Closes-Bug: #1573465
Change-Id: I8dad569262162b03b79699a13e028c2fc8244c92
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-25 07:45:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/e7c3d43faa0f02378f6484d9436dcbe6e018c7f2', 'message': 'unify security group rule ICMPv6 protocol options

Current code have different behaviors for three different ICMPv6
protocol options when creating a security group rule.

For "icmpv6" and "ipv6-icmp" options, it will add a new record with
"output == PORT_ID && ip6",
and for "icmp" option, it will add a new record with
"output == PORT_ID && ip6 && icmp6".

The different result will cause potential security risk when using
"icmpv6" and "ipv6-icmp" options to create a security group rule
for ICMPv6 Protocol.

This patch will fix this.
And by unifying the ICMPv6 protocol options, we can also avoid
duplicated records creation happened in ACL table.

Closes-Bug: #1573465
Change-Id: I8dad569262162b03b79699a13e028c2fc8244c92

"icmpv6" and "ipv6-icmp" options to create a security group rule
for ICMPv6 Protocol.

This patch will fix this.
And by unifying the ICMPv6 protocol options, we can also avoid
duplicated records creation happened in ACL table.

Closes-Bug: #1573465
Change-Id: I8dad569262162b03b79699a13e028c2fc8244c92

commit_message:
make acl match recognize ipv6 icmp alias and number

Current code in OVNPlugin _acl_protocol_and_ports fails to recognize
icmpv6 and ipv6-icmp protocol type and protocol number 58 for IPv6
ICMP.

This patch fixes that issue.

Partial-Bug: #1573465
Change-Id: I8dad569262162b03b79699a13e028c2fc8244c92
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/04/309304/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.common import constants as n_const elif r['protocol'] in ('icmp', 'ipv6-icmp'): rule = security_group_rule['security_group_rule'] # unify ICMP protocol for IPv6 if (rule['protocol'] == n_const.PROTO_NAME_IPV6_ICMP_LEGACY or (rule['ethertype'] == const.IPv6 and rule['protocol'] == const.PROTO_NAME_ICMP)): rule['protocol'] = const.PROTO_NAME_IPV6_ICMP

commit_message:
Nailgun Fixes for smart configuration changes support

Simply unhardcode the handler for $.configuration namespace
to allow a user to modify anything he wants in this namespace.
The list of modifyable sections on '$.configuration' namespace of astute.yaml
should not be hardcoded - this makes no sense as support of these pieces
is implemented on fuel library and plugins side. Hardcoding the list
will make it impossible for a plugin developer to reuse configuration
changes feature to support configuration options for plugin.

DocImpact

Partial-bug: #1580522

Change-Id: I4eb18461c0a4f337b649abfcd099259965290ff5
(cherry picked from commit 5b2607ab8f371e3479775f09e6ebc8915813ab17)

commit_message:
Disabled attributes should be skipped by validation

Currently restrictions skip only attributes with 'hide' action.
Attributes with 'disabled' action(except 'checkboxes' and group attributes)
should be skipped as well to avoid regex validation.

Change-Id: I3869f1d8a3e4f322f38b94da8d7f267b3ebfa611
Closes-Bug: #1580077

You'll need to provide the authentication method and your credentials to :program:`gnocchi`. :option:`--os-tenant-id` and :option:`--os-auth-url` options, but it's easier to just set them as environment variables: Your username. The OpenStack auth server URL (Keystone). No authentication ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ If you're using Gnocchi with no authentication, export the following variables in your environment:: export OS_AUTH_TYPE=gnocchi-noauth export GNOCCHI_USER_ID=<youruserid> export GNOCCHI_PROJECT_ID=<yourprojectid> export GNOCCHI_ENDPOINT=http://urlofgnocchi OpenStack Keystone authentication ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ If you're using Gnocchi with Keystone authentication, export the following variables in your environment::The command line tool will attempt to reauthenticate using your provided credentials for every request. commit_message:
Add network segment resource

Add network segment resource in support of routed networks.
This patch set includes the following:
  - Network segment resource
  - Proxy read interfaces for the network segment resource
  - Documentation updates
  - Unit tests
  - Functional tests (currently skipped)

The documentation provides a caution notice since this support
is a work in progress and is subject to change.

Change-Id: I6166a49ec52206314f3766aa55523e7be54db348
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
Add option to download all libs from git

For client debugging that invokes multiple libs it can be useful
to have all libs directly in git and not listing all of them
in LIBS_FROM_GIT.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ie631cc4045231ebbe8177d2d113e47e4bf83f61c

commit_message:
Make sure delorean.repo takes precedence over delorean-deps.repo

By moving the priority of delorean.repo to 2, it has the same
priority as delorean-deps.repo. This can lead to installing
packages from delorean-deps instead of delorean.

Change-Id: I1ef8c740c8cdfcb84387376d4a908efd97a2525f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/14/318314/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Move setting lvm libvirt configs to hypervisor-libvirt

When the nova backend is LVM we set some libvirt configs
in nova.conf. Those should happen in the libvirt plugin
file rather than the generic nova file since it's specific
to running nova-compute with libvirt.

Change-Id: I37a63a5fba2e9eea4daafe4ec390b2e7aac236f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/55/318255/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Revert "Switch from optimal alignment to minimum"

That switching is way too intrusive.
It's better to give a user an ability to control which alignment mode
will be used by adding an option to fuel-agent config file.

This reverts commit 4c74eaa1875dd28d2e2c8256281d9088f83f25fb.

Change-Id: Ia492d1479da170a9c76633c9b87c165c47f8d34b

commit_message:
Cannot execute only selected tasks

It should be possible to select some tasks and execute
only the selected tasks instead of all the tasks.
But the current behavior does not allow to execute only the
selected tasks. This is due to the fact that the variable
conataining the selected tasks is overridden to contain
all the tasks before the execution. That variable should be
overridden only if the initial value was None.
This commit will fix the issue.

Change-Id: If3538e0fbd7ad4c77f9170f3c2f45bc0f987f765
Closes-Bug: #1570818

commit_message:
Fix pre-task-deployment tasks convertation

This fix does proper generation of dependencies for pre-task-based
deployment tasks. It checks if a deployment task is in pre-/post-
or main deployment graph and assigns dependencies properly without
creating dependencies loops.

Example:

taskA: requires: post-deployment-start, groups:B

w/o this fix it would create the following loop:

taskA->B_end->post-deployment-start->taskA

Change-Id: Iaa5d87946c1a9957d99a329009d578c210b6f888
Closes-bug: #1572276
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/11/313111/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import sixfrom nailgun import errorsimport networkx as nx role = task.get('roles', task.get('groups')) if isinstance(role, six.string_types): return [role] else: return role # Sync points generated as a separate graph # Full role-based graph to detect whether a task should be in a deployment # group or in pre/post stage. role_based_graph = GraphSolver(tasks=copy.deepcopy(deployment_tasks)) if not role_based_graph.is_acyclic(): err = "Role-based deployment graph contains cycles in legacy tasks:" err += ', '.join(six.moves.map(str, nx.simple_cycles( nx.DiGraph(role_based_graph)))) err += '\n' raise errors.InvalidData(err) pre_deployment_graph = role_based_graph.find_subgraph( end='pre_deployment_end') post_deployment_graph = role_based_graph.find_subgraph( start='post_deployment_start') if task['id'] in pre_deployment_graph.node: required_for.extend( TASK_END_TEMPLATE.format('pre_deployment') ) elif task['id'] in post_deployment_graph.node: required_for.extend( TASK_END_TEMPLATE.format('post_deployment') ) else: required_for.extend( TASK_END_TEMPLATE.format(x) for x in role_resolver.get_all_roles(_get_role(task)) ) task['required_for'] = required_for if task['id'] in pre_deployment_graph.node: logger.warning( "Binding legacy task to pre_deployment stage: %s", task['id']) yield _join_task_to_group(task, ['pre_deployment']) elif task['id'] in post_deployment_graph.node: logger.warning( "Binding legacy task to post_deployment stage: %s", task['id']) yield _join_task_to_group(task, ['post_deployment']) else: logger.warning( "Added cross_depends for legacy task: %s", task['id']) yield _join_task_to_group( task, role_resolver.get_all_roles(_get_role(task)) )
deleted_lines: return task.get('roles', task.get('groups')) required_for.extend( TASK_END_TEMPLATE.format(x) for x in role_resolver.get_all_roles(_get_role(task)) ) task['required_for'] = required_for logger.warning("Added cross_depends for legacy task: %s", task['id']) yield _join_task_to_group( task, role_resolver.get_all_roles(_get_role(task)) )

Skip EPEL & RDO install for CI nodes

If the nodepool info file is around, assume we're on a OpenStack CI
node and skip re-installing EPEL & RDO

Change-Id: Ife80af015b26514098e0633f568e3da35b9eea8c

commit_message:
In worlddump, cover all supported version of OpenFlow protocol by ovs-ofctl

This change includes the following commits.

Fix a typo in comment for _get_ofp_version

OpenFlow11 -> OpenFlow10

Change-Id: I2a501ccd32f5f7a39fd4bc746f00ca3f67bd98c1
(cherry picked from commit 2bd2568bd186162f44814d149030368cfa2db006)

In worlddump, cover all supported version of OpenFlow protocol by ovs-ofctl

Currently ovs-ofctl command is executed for only default ofp version
(OpenFlow10).
Some Neutron's plugin uses OpenFlow13 and in that case ovs-ofctl fails.
This chage allows us to get ovs info for all ofp versions supported by ovs.
And adds dump by dump-ports and dump-ports-desc.

Change-Id: I2d3c42835a5ad0f5ebf540e8127762f466347c9c
(cherry picked from commit 6099401e002f228daf5110e1dd0a530dc1c737fc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/52/318952/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This method gets a max openflow version supported by openvswitch. # For example 'ovs-ofctl --version' displays the following: # # ovs-ofctl (Open vSwitch) 2.0.2 # Compiled Dec 9 2015 14:08:08 # OpenFlow versions 0x1:0x4 # # The above shows that openvswitch supports from OpenFlow10 to OpenFlow13. # This method gets max version searching 'OpenFlow versions 0x1:0x'. # And return a version value converted to an integer type. def _get_ofp_version(): process = subprocess.Popen(['ovs-ofctl', '--version'], stdout=subprocess.PIPE) stdout, _ = process.communicate() find_str = 'OpenFlow versions 0x1:0x' offset = stdout.find(find_str) return int(stdout[offset + len(find_str):-1]) - 1 ofctl_cmds = ('show', 'dump-ports-desc', 'dump-ports', 'dump-flows') ofp_max = _get_ofp_version() vers = 'OpenFlow10' for i in range(ofp_max + 1): vers += ',OpenFlow1' + str(i) for ofctl_cmd in ofctl_cmds: for bridge in bridges: args = {'vers': vers, 'cmd': ofctl_cmd, 'bridge': bridge} _dump_cmd("sudo ovs-ofctl --protocols=%(vers)s %(cmd)s %(bridge)s" % args)
deleted_lines: for bridge in bridges: _dump_cmd("sudo ovs-ofctl show %s" % bridge) for bridge in bridges: _dump_cmd("sudo ovs-ofctl dump-flows %s" % bridge)

Switch to headline only in index

spec repos. Otherwise it list also sub-heading within the documents
(which is basically the same for all documents).

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Create new non-released oslo managed oslo.tools repository

This repository and subproject will be for useful tools
extracted from the oslo incubator and used by various folks in
the oslo community (as well as the ptl).

Its creation will allow for completion of the retirement of
the oslo-incubator repo.

Depends-On: Id5ed1a47c9bf1e4b25557b8ce802ef01694a2780
Change-Id: I818886696aee39c2fef786f21c59202b4ced1dbe

commit_message:
Fix Neutron enable_*_agent* Hiera parameters

This change will fix a logic error when L3 agent was disabled, where
a Pacemaker constraint (neutron-dhcp-agent-to-l3-agent-constraint) were
still looking for l3_agent_service in the Puppet catalog, but could not
because L3 agent was disabled.
It was sending this Puppet error:
Error: Could not find dependency
Pacemaker::Resource::Service[neutron-l3-agent] for
Pacemaker::Constraint::Base[neutron-dhcp-agent-to-l3-agent-constraint]

Closes-Bug: 1583988
Change-Id: I0e5d24d844810c58a3205303399d1c20773af3dd
(cherry picked from commit 887f35b0f1fcc2218636564948f36170ed077934)

commit_message:
Fixed require statements for puppet 4

This change updates the require statements in the providers
to resolve the issues with the autoloader in puppet. This
issue technically always existed but was masked prior to the
split with puppet server and puppet agent because both used to
share the same loadpath. Documentation on this issue can be
read at https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-4450.

Change-Id: I72a27fe92a41a5eb845adba6b82252b8aac1c164

commit_message:
Add assert:supports-rolling-upgrade to Neutron

 - The base framework supports the ability to roll out
   partial upgrades to agent nodes and have older agents
   work seamlessly with newer server nodes.
 - Neutron has online db schema migrations.
 - Neutron has CI testing (genade-multinode) to validate
   mixed deployments [1]

This strictly applies to the core neutron platform and more will have
to be added over time to refine this capability.

[1] http://grafana.openstack.org/dashboard/db/neutron-failure-rate?panelId=7&fullscreen

Depends-on: I60c6395ba08d404dcceb83bb282a8d1d8a2ed380
Change-Id: Id06610655dae4cb0d5c555afb78e59529ab2689c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/17/286817/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - assert:supports-rolling-upgrade

commit_message:
Replace context building with a request object

First step to using a sane request object everywhere is to make a
request that has the old context dict available. This way we can still
use the old context dict just refer to it via the request object.

Change-Id: Ibcd64791ba52c550b555a007feb847a068da2299
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/57/318657/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystone.common import request as request_mod @webob.dec.wsgify(RequestClass=request_mod.Request) 'req_method': req.method.upper(), result = method(req.context_dict, **params) return render_exception(e, context=req.context_dict, return render_exception(e, context=req.context_dict, context=req.context_dict, context=req.context_dict, return render_response(body=result, status=response_code, method=req.method) @webob.dec.wsgify(RequestClass=request_mod.Request) @webob.dec.wsgify(RequestClass=request_mod.Request) @webob.dec.wsgify(RequestClass=request_mod.Request) @webob.dec.wsgify(RequestClass=request_mod.Request) @webob.dec.wsgify(RequestClass=request_mod.Request)
deleted_lines: @webob.dec.wsgify() # allow middleware up the stack to provide context, params and headers. context = req.environ.get(CONTEXT_ENV, {}) try: context['query_string'] = dict(req.params.items()) except UnicodeDecodeError as e: # The webob package throws UnicodeError when a request cannot be # decoded. Raise ValidationError instead to avoid an UnknownError. msg = _('Query string is not UTF-8 encoded') raise exception.ValidationError(msg) context['headers'] = dict(req.headers.items()) context['path'] = req.environ['PATH_INFO'] scheme = req.environ.get(CONF.secure_proxy_ssl_header) if scheme: # NOTE(andrey-mp): "wsgi.url_scheme" contains the protocol used # before the proxy removed it ('https' usually). So if # the webob.Request instance is modified in order to use this # scheme instead of the one defined by API, the call to # webob.Request.relative_url() will return a URL with the correct # scheme. req.environ['wsgi.url_scheme'] = scheme context['host_url'] = req.host_url # authentication and authorization attributes are set as environment # values by the container and processed by the pipeline. The complete # set is not yet known. context['environment'] = req.environ context['accept_header'] = req.accept req.environ = None context.setdefault('is_admin', False) 'req_method': req.environ['REQUEST_METHOD'].upper(), result = method(context, **params) return render_exception(e, context=context, return render_exception(e, context=context, context=context, context=context, return render_response(body=result, status=response_code, method=req.environ['REQUEST_METHOD']) @webob.dec.wsgify() @webob.dec.wsgify() @webob.dec.wsgify() @webob.dec.wsgify() @webob.dec.wsgify()

commit_message:
Add other-requirements.txt for bindep

Bindep is a binary automation tool used in openstack-infra.  With it,
projects can better control the default packages installed into the
OS. Because we are using puppet, we actually don't want any packages
installed by default as to better test our manifests.

Change-Id: Icc52372a90946e1874b42b52f677d29039e952c2
Co-Authored-By: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

Add other-requirements.txt for bindep

Bindep is a binary automation tool used in openstack-infra.  With it,
projects can better control the default packages installed into the
OS. Because we are using puppet, we actually don't want any packages
installed by default as to better test our manifests.

commit_message:
Check if cirros is cached locally for tempest

If found, create a symlink for tempest. This will stop the need for
downloading the image for every job.

Change-Id: I1986b8c6849f5a18b83245e927bfff513ce5f84f
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/71/318271/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Note(pabelanger): We cache cirros images on our jenkins slaves, check if it # exists. if [ -f ~/cache/files/cirros-0.3.4-x86_64-disk.img ]; then # Create a symlink for tempest. ln -s ~/cache/files/cirros-0.3.4-x86_64-disk.img /tmp/openstack/tempest else wget http://download.cirros-cloud.net/0.3.4/cirros-0.3.4-x86_64-disk.img -P /tmp/openstack/tempest fi
deleted_lines: # TODO(emilien) later, we should use local image if present. That would be a next iteration. wget http://download.cirros-cloud.net/0.3.4/cirros-0.3.4-x86_64-disk.img -P /tmp/openstack/tempest

commit_message:
minor cleanup of config-ml2-plug-in rst file

changed to An L2 for consistency across doc
changed an mechanism to a mechanism
changed an PCI Virtual to a PCI Virtual
changed from ovs to OVS for consistency across doc

Change-Id: Ic64d117505b6e4629d365ef379fa1eceea78201c
(cherry picked from commit 0951dfe93a6c2bb239c5aad9db2cd0eba35dbef7)

commit_message:
Add other-requirements.txt for bindep

Bindep is a binary automation tool used in openstack-infra.  With it,
projects can better control the default packages installed into the
OS. Because we are using puppet, we actually don't want any packages
installed by default as to better test our manifests.

Change-Id: I3cb870959a8e9b009fffbc65a544aef6ed2c3b68
Co-Authored-By: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Create networks only if nova-network is enabled

The problem is that if we use nova-network and multi host configuration, [1,2]
nova-network service can be not run yet. This is a problem because nova_network
provider uses nova client and then as nova-api just does an RPC call to
nova-network, which actually creates networks [3]. This impacts multinode
configurations with nova-network services running only on compute node.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/openstack-ops/content/network_design.html
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/openstack-ops/content/example_architecture.html
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/network/api.py#L103

Closes-bug: #1501767

Change-Id: I44d78e946c0e01e883c6d54bb54054200aae4aee
(cherry picked from commit f9ff60e66a9a263a01d4ea7cc5482dcc7d776ea7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/96/317996/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Angular pages will reload if collapse/expand sidebar

use ng-images as example to explan the issue:
1.enable ng-images page and go into this page.
2.click left sidebar to collapse/expand a dashboard or panel-group
3.the url change to "project/ngimages/#sidebar-accordion-***" which
  match the route[1]. Current page will reload even it's not change.

Use "data-target" instead of "href" to fix it. ref:[2]

[1]https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/
openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/images.module.js#L190
[2]https://github.com/openstack/xstatic-bootstrap-scss/blob/
master/xstatic/pkg/bootstrap_scss/data/js/bootstrap.js#L505

Change-Id: I1c84c6af49a67bf2833ad5b0103f6cbd4abd0ddb
Closes-Bug: #1543327

commit_message:
Deploy provisioned nodes with clean state

We shouldn't skip tasks, if node is in provisioned state,
so clear state in this case.

Partial-Bug: #1573105
Change-Id: If8536cbd2559e745ad69dffc0ca8847015e1180e
(cherry picked from commit be437a8e7e91fc1b1f4ce38e2f8659def7fa11ae)

added_lines: def check_correct_state_calculation(self, provision, state_mock, tasks_mock, rpc_mock): 'roles': ['primary-controller'], 'version': '2.1.0', 'condition': {'yaql_exp': 'changed($.uid)'}, if provision: node.status = consts.NODE_STATUSES.provisioned for task in tasks_graph[node.uid]: if task['id'] == 'test1': if provision: self.assertNotEqual( task['type'], consts.ORCHESTRATOR_TASK_TYPES.skipped) else: self.assertEqual( task['type'], consts.ORCHESTRATOR_TASK_TYPES.skipped) def test_correct_state_calculation(self): self.check_correct_state_calculation(False) def test_state_calculation_after_provision(self): self.check_correct_state_calculation(True)
deleted_lines: def test_correct_state_calculation(self, state_mock, tasks_mock, rpc_mock): 'roles': ['master'], 'version': '2.1.0', 'condition': {'yaql_exp': 'changed($)'}, for task in tasks_graph['master']: if task['id'] == 'test1': self.assertEqual( task['type'], consts.ORCHESTRATOR_TASK_TYPES.skipped)

commit_message:
Fix and tidy backup action

During refactoring of the actions codebase, the backup
action managed to miss getting the default 'args' parameter.

Add args parameter so the the backup action is functional again.

Enable pep8 checking of actions, tidy up issues.

Use boolean action options as real booleans, not as strings.

Change-Id: Ia75dd90ac31dce4009fd44f8c1d582814134e3d9
Closes-Bug: 1583898
(cherry picked from commit 094873d629c6117cec4d0c3c9788cd754d031752)

commit_message:
Allow update of network configuration for bootstrap nodes only

Before this change, bonds get broken (their slaves become lost)
when node gets 'error' status after netconfig is done.
So, redeployment of such node would not be successful.

Change-Id: I9de989d0566cf4e5e1e735ec432cb921f43522eb
Closes-Bug: 1580541
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/83/318083/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix keystone tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-20 01:52:20.000000000', 'files': ['tests/inventory', 'tests/test-prepare-containers.yml', 'tests/group_vars/all_containers.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone/commit/994bb0f40c19d626fb964f87f1e2710f3c36ea75', 'message': "Fix keystone tests

Update test-prepare-containers.yml to use the default, inventory
defined, remote connections for hosts so that tasks intended for
containers run as expected.

I0351dddc49da5908f46e09e22467f6fb112593dd recently merged in keystone
causing the service to exit when fernet keys do not exist and this
role's functional testing to fail.

The 'Distribute the fernet key repository' task uses the
'ansible_ssh_host' variable from members of the 'keystone_all[1:]'
group. Since 'ansible_ssh_host' is set through group_vars based on the
current working host's 'ansible_host', it's not looked up correctly
within loops and fernet keys are only being synced within the same host.

Move 'ansible_ssh_host' from being dynamically assigned in group_vars to
being statically assigned within the inventory.

Change-Id: I177fadb728206285996f7ffb9d522db8ec63114b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix keystone tests

Update test-prepare-containers.yml to use the default, inventory
defined, remote connections for hosts so that tasks intended for
containers run as expected.

I0351dddc49da5908f46e09e22467f6fb112593dd recently merged in keystone
causing the service to exit when fernet keys do not exist and this
role's functional testing to fail.

The 'Distribute the fernet key repository' task uses the
'ansible_ssh_host' variable from members of the 'keystone_all[1:]'
group. Since 'ansible_ssh_host' is set through group_vars based on the
current working host's 'ansible_host', it's not looked up correctly
within loops and fernet keys are only being synced within the same host.

Move 'ansible_ssh_host' from being dynamically assigned in group_vars to
being statically assigned within the inventory.

Change-Id: I177fadb728206285996f7ffb9d522db8ec63114b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/16/319016/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[networking] Add QoS default burst value

Add note about default burst value in underlying
implementation of QoS bandwidth limit rules for Open
vSwitch and Linux bridge agents.

Change-Id: I4e8af070128c33634b14393ec2d964c1f55c6dc1
Closes-Bug: #1582407
Co-Authored-By: Matt Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/45/317645/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: Burst value is required to ensure proper behaviour of bandwidth limit rule. If busts value is not provided by user, underneath implementation for both L2 agents: Open vSwitch and linuxbridge will set burst value as 80% of given bandwidth limit value. This will ensure proper bandwidth limit at least for TCP traffic.

commit_message:
Add ExtraConfig example that always runs on update

Some user feedback indicates we need better examples showing how
we can run an extraconfig template, e.g on post-deploy so that it
runs every update, regardless of if a change to the config has
occurred.  We can leverage DeployIdentifier for this, just like with
the puppet deployments.

This can be tested with an example like this:

resource_registry:
  OS::TripleO::NodeExtraConfigPost: tripleo-heat-templates/extraconfig/post_deploy/example_run_on_update.yaml

Change-Id: I45d8f8093ab45c03238ec56651c437128661cb95
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/88/296488/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: heat_template_version: 2014-10-16 description: > Example extra config for post-deployment, this re-runs every update # Note extra parameters can be defined, then passed data via the # environment parameter_defaults, without modifying the parent template parameters: servers: type: json # This is provided via parameter_defaults from tripleoclient # it changes to a new timestamp every update, so we can use it to # trigger the deployment to run even though it and the config are # otherwise unchanged DeployIdentifier: type: string resources: ExtraConfig: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: script inputs: - name: deploy_identifier config: | #!/bin/sh echo "extra_update $deploy_identifier" >> /root/extra_update ExtraDeployments: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployments properties: name: ExtraDeployments servers: {get_param: servers} config: {get_resource: ExtraConfig} # Do this on CREATE/UPDATE (which is actually the default) actions: ['CREATE', 'UPDATE'] input_values: deploy_identifier: {get_param: DeployIdentifier}

commit_message:
Add public_endpoint parameter

public_endpoint allows to set URL to use when building the links to the API
resources.
If the API is operating behind a proxy, user will want to change this to
represent the proxy's URL.

Change-Id: Ic85497dd957cf1de738da728c1b0f5b87fecfb79
(cherry picked from commit bf6842e525f6b98324d2e31b5be6ef85012a90dd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic refs/changes/05/317905/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*public_endpoint*] # (Optional) Public URL to use when building the links to the API resources # Defaults to $::os_service_default # $public_endpoint = $::os_service_default, 'api/host_ip': value => $host_ip; 'api/port': value => $port; 'api/max_limit': value => $max_limit; 'api/api_workers': value => $workers; 'api/public_endpoint': value => $public_endpoint;

commit_message:
Adds the base and pacemaker profile for the memcached service

Implements: blueprint refactor-puppet-manifests

This is the puppet-tripleo side for the memcached as a composable
service.  The related tht review that uses this is at
I8802c2a0cf1e5fa1a6d1fab5e87f6014bea2f517

Change-Id: Icd504aef7dda144582c286c56c925a78566af72c

commit_message:
Use check_string_length from oslo_utils

This patch removes code from check_string_length method
in utils.py and makes call to check_string_length method
from oslo_utils.strutils.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I53a0ca83e0d163ccd7a8b0985573fd6adf2db669
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/72/309272/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: strutils.check_string_length(value, name=name, min_length=min_length, max_length=max_length) except (ValueError, TypeError) as exc: raise exception.InvalidInput(message=exc.args[0])
deleted_lines: if not isinstance(value, six.string_types): msg = _("%s is not a string or unicode") % name raise exception.InvalidInput(message=msg) if len(value) < min_length: msg = _("%(name)s has a minimum character requirement of " "%(min_length)s.") % {'name': name, 'min_length': min_length} raise exception.InvalidInput(message=msg) if max_length and len(value) > max_length: msg = _("%(name)s has more than %(max_length)s " "characters.") % {'name': name, 'max_length': max_length} raise exception.InvalidInput(message=msg)

commit_message:
Add other-requirements.txt for bindep

Bindep is a binary automation tool used in openstack-infra.  With it,
projects can better control the default packages installed into the
OS. Because we are using puppet, we actually don't want any packages
installed by default as to better test our manifests.

Change-Id: If9195f772da010e8be4c87163b7149780aaaafe0
Co-Authored-By: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-vitrage refs/changes/04/318804/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Bindep is a binary automation tool used in openstack-infra.  With it,
projects can better control the default packages installed into the
OS. Because we are using puppet, we actually don't want any packages
installed by default as to better test our manifests.

Change-Id: I669ab1ed30493ccc7b58589b4af081af2f5d7e82
Co-Authored-By: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use a different ceph key for admin/client user

By default only the admin user key is generated and this key is used
for both admin and openstack user.
Because the mode of the client's key file is 644, any user with a
valid shell on the controller/compute/ceph nodes can made admin
operations on the ceph cluster.
This patch allows to used the random key generated by tripleoclient
for the openstack user.

Change-Id: I771bbee81c0acfe593e92a99ad12d6f1f7f445ef
Closes-bug: #1566927
Depends-On: I404665c09084f0a6cd2d8872940ee90220dc5f69
(cherry picked from commit d3b841ce1dcfe27eab03cc50444783e38891812c)

commit_message:
Remove obsolete keepalived PID files before start

keepalived refuses to start and claims "daemon already started"
when there is already a process with the same PID as found in
either the VRRP or the main process PID file. This happens even
in case when the new process is not keepalived. The situation
can happen when the neutron node is reset and the obsolete PID
files are not cleaned before neutron is started.

This commit adds PID file cleanup before keepalived start.

Closes-Bug: 1561046
Change-Id: Ib6b6f2fe76fe82253f195c9eab6b243d9eb76fa2
(cherry picked from commit e98fabb5836b12bc40a2b64a2668893ea73c2320)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/35/299135/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix and tidy backup action
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-20 09:07:05.000000000', 'files': ['actions/actions.py', 'tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-percona-cluster/commit/094873d629c6117cec4d0c3c9788cd754d031752', 'message': "Fix and tidy backup action

During refactoring of the actions codebase, the backup
action managed to miss getting the default 'args' parameter.

Add args parameter so the the backup action is functional again.

Enable pep8 checking of actions, tidy up issues.

Use boolean action options as real booleans, not as strings.

Change-Id: Ia75dd90ac31dce4009fd44f8c1d582814134e3d9
Closes-Bug: 1583898
"}]
commit_message:
Fix and tidy backup action

During refactoring of the actions codebase, the backup
action managed to miss getting the default 'args' parameter.

Add args parameter so the the backup action is functional again.

Enable pep8 checking of actions, tidy up issues.

Use boolean action options as real booleans, not as strings.

Change-Id: Ia75dd90ac31dce4009fd44f8c1d582814134e3d9
Closes-Bug: 1583898
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-percona-cluster refs/changes/38/319138/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = flake8 {posargs} hooks unit_tests tests actions

commit_message:
Add enable_proxy_headers_parsing option

This option determines if the middleware should parse the
headers or not. Can be used in case if application is
behind the reverse proxy.

Change-Id: I22deb886706fe71115a04fb52a7051be4783a5c4
Related-bug: #1576740

commit_message:
Update 60-setup-testenvs to match what we use

This updates the entire file to match exactly what is being used on
the testenvs. In particular the number of test envs is hard coded to
3 and some logic is added to use the recently installed SSD's.

Change-Id: Ie91a9615181193183a06eae5e40997faacf4f4e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/90/315290/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Deploy 5 hosts per testenv export NODE_CNT=5 # Mount the rh1 ssd's to the libvirt images dir # assume the SSD is the last drive on the list SSD=$(ls /dev/sd[a-z] | sort | tail -n 1) mkfs.ext4 -F $SSD mount -t ext4 $SSD /var/lib/libvirt/images

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-13 17:46:12.000000000', 'files': ['environments/network-environment.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/0fc5a7a0d268aa1f0d6f9e8222bc357d63eef3c8', 'message': 'Updates ControlPlaneSubnetCidr to be a string

Heat is unable to execute the following join when creating the

Resulting in the following error, upon deploymnet:

2016-03-30 22:44:17 [overcloud-Controller-wazxxjc6dq22-2-2ictqfdx2nuo]:

(cherry picked from commit b90311442ded1a9f21a160fc57e1e210a240df7f)

commit_message:
Updates ControlPlaneSubnetCidr to be a string

Heat is unable to execute the following join when creating the
os-net-config definition (OsNetConfigImpl):

	addresses:
	-
		ip_netmask:
		list_join:
		- '/'
		- - {get_param: ControlPlaneIp}
	          - {get_param: ControlPlaneSubnetCidr}

In the default network-environment.yaml environment file the
ControlPlaneSubnetCidr is defaulted as a non-string "24", e.g.

	ControlPlaneSubnetCidr: 24

Resulting in the following error, upon deploymnet:

2016-03-30 22:44:17 [overcloud-Controller-wazxxjc6dq22-2-2ictqfdx2nuo]:
  CREATE_FAILED  Resource CREATE failed:
    resources.NetworkConfig:
      Property error:
        resources.OsNetConfigImpl.properties.config:
          Items to join must be strings not 24

This patch simply updates the default value to '24', to match other
templates. This allows a deployment to succeed as expected.

Change-Id: I5f75b02dba5c35a9856c6ceff9cf6c24a0cb56d8
(cherry picked from commit b90311442ded1a9f21a160fc57e1e210a240df7f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/32/316232/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ControlPlaneSubnetCidr: '24'
