commit_message:
Add other-requirements.txt for bindep

Bindep is a binary automation tool used in openstack-infra.  With it,
projects can better control the default packages installed into the
OS. Because we are using puppet, we actually don't want any packages
installed by default as to better test our manifests.

Change-Id: Ic8e4334cee48a3ef604c3aa062539e6fe3b32232
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
oidc: Remove unused parameters in _OidcBase

Some methods in _OidcBase accepted a parameter to indicate the URL where
a request was to be made:

- _get_keystone_token accepted federated_token_url, the URL for
  federated authentication.
- _get_access_token accepted access_token_endpoint, the URL used to get
  an oidc access token.

However, the methods were using internally the object attribute
self.access_token_endpoint and the property self.federated_token_url,
therefore the parameters were completely ignored. This changes removes
them and adjust the derived classes.

Change-Id: Ibc2157d47cb0edd59c4d966bae77c102423f97ae

commit_message:
[Doc] Update quick start guide to Mitaka release

Also, corrected casing in the usage of the project names.

Change-Id: I2077bd27f6f3b8ef84b91c81b08e9d6eba1f68fd
Closes-Bug: #1562086

added_lines: This document describes how to install Manila from the OpenStack `Mitaka` $ git clone -b stable/mitaka https://github.com/openstack/manila $ sudo pip install python-manilaclient>=1.5.0 The starting version of the Manila client for Mitaka release is 1.5.0.. code-block:: console $ openstack user create --name manila --password %PASSWORD%.. code-block:: console $ openstack role add --user manila --project service admin.. code-block:: console $ openstack service create \ --name manila \ --description "OpenStack Shared Filesystems"\ share $ openstack service create \ --description "OpenStack Shared Filesystems"\ sharev2.. code-block:: console $ openstack endpoint create \ --region regionOne \ share public \ http://%controller%:8786/v1/%\(tenant_id\)s $ openstack endpoint create \ --region regionOne \ share internal \ http://%controller%:8786/v1/%\(tenant_id\)s $ openstack endpoint create \ --region regionOne \ share admin \ http://%controller%:8786/v1/%\(tenant_id\)s $ openstack endpoint create \ --region regionOne \ sharev2 public \ http://%controller%:8786/v2/%\(tenant_id\)s $ openstack endpoint create \ --region regionOne \ sharev2 internal \ http://%controller%:8786/v2/%\(tenant_id\)s $ openstack endpoint create \ --region regionOne \ sharev2 admin \ http://%controller%:8786/v2/%\(tenant_id\)s Result for each action (internal, public and admin) should be similar to:: +-------------+-----------------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +-------------+-----------------------------------------------+ | id | c1984777db6941919657d15b25f05c94 | | internalurl | http://%controller%:8786/v[1,2]/%(tenant_id)s | | region | regionOne | | service_id | 4c13e9ff7ec04f4e95a26f72ecdf9919 | +-------------+-----------------------------------------------+ [neutron] # Only needed when networking driver is set to Neutron and share drivers # supports "driver handles share server" (DHSS) username = neutron password = %password% project_domain_id = default project_name = service user_domain_id = default auth_url = http://127.0.0.1:5000 auth_type = password [nova] username = nova password = %password% project_domain_id = default project_name = service user_domain_id = default auth_url = http://127.0.0.1:5000 auth_type = password [cinder] username = cinder password = %password% project_domain_id = default project_name = service user_domain_id = default auth_url = http://127.0.0.1:5000 auth_type = password Here is the list of tables for the Mitaka release of Manila:: | optional_extra_specs | +-----------+--------------------+------------+------------+-------------------------------------+-------------------------+ | %some_id% | default_share_type | public | YES | driver_handles_share_servers : True | snapshot_support : True | +-----------+--------------------+------------+------------+-------------------------------------+-------------------------+

commit_message:
crypto - wrap random body key

use a random key to encrypt the object body, wrap that body key
with keymaster provided object key and persist wrapped key in
object sysmeta header for crypto meta.

Wrap using AES CTR mode with IV, not aes_wrap_key algorithm,
for performance.

Change-Id: I4c2ba12dd35bb3f4951dce65bc7f488a332e0c18

commit_message:
Resource types for reference and parent id

Searchlight should provide resource type info
for any reference IDs in the facet results.
Parent reference types should also be part of the info.

Change-Id: I4b0299dd9b93e7e7b84c9430b100b90561fc0e22
Implements: blueprint disoverable-resource-type-relationships

commit_message:
Add tests for floating_ip private functions

There are 2 try/except blocks within _translate_floating_ip_view() that
cause in different resulting dictionaries. These situations are
untested, so now we can test for different scenarios of missing
attributes on the floating IP. An if check was also added to the
function because the types passed in are objects, so if the attribute is
not set on the object, it raises a NotImplementedError. So instead of
catching that too, we check to see if the key is in the object (which
checks if it is set).

Change-Id: Ia5739f214f57525b3083ef3f201f6f08198703e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/68/267768/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Auth: Add support to choose Catalog/Endpoint name

* for v2, if the catalog/endpoint name is supplied
  in the auth provider filter, then the matching
  entry will be returned

Change-Id: Ide9eaef0179e4d8b31b7f5ac048204d3e8821b33
Closes-Bug: #1486834

commit_message:
Fix keystone auth url in devstack plugin

Currently the keystone auth uri will be set like:
auth_uri = http://127.0.0.1:35357/v3/v2.0
Obviously this is incorrect. Attempting to fix this somewhat sanely.

Change-Id: If443d9625cb9155a378a674aff07ba663b508446
Closes-Bug: #1582879
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/90/318290/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ "$OCTAVIA_AUTH_VERSION" == "2" ] ; then AUTH_URI=${KEYSTONE_AUTH_URI%/v3}/v2.0 else AUTH_URI=${KEYSTONE_AUTH_URI} fi iniset $OCTAVIA_CONF keystone_authtoken auth_uri ${AUTH_URI}

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-16 10:24:21.000000000', 'files': ['mcagents/erase_node.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute/commit/cc2ffdab6ca90ddb2e82efe638de4514c6d2ec62', 'message': "Fix cleaning boot sectors of disks on delete

Bootloaders may check MBR signature to determine,
if it can boot from thios disk. So let's clear it
together with boot code.

Also #{dev[:name]} is just a name of a device, like
sdb, so add /dev/ path.

Change-Id: Ifc23fe4e4919a10b3d5546c98ee333ccac9c92f2
(cherry picked from commit 3c00fb65501235692af2c586bb113e7bb37e5039)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cleaning boot sectors of disks on delete

Bootloaders may check MBR signature to determine,
if it can boot from thios disk. So let's clear it
together with boot code.

Also #{dev[:name]} is just a name of a device, like
sdb, so add /dev/ path.

Change-Id: Ifc23fe4e4919a10b3d5546c98ee333ccac9c92f2
(cherry picked from commit 3c00fb65501235692af2c586bb113e7bb37e5039)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/04/316704/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: system("dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/#{dev[:name]} bs=446 count=1") # clear out the signature system("dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/#{dev[:name]} seek=510 bs=1 count=2")

commit_message:
Update openstack-ansible-security role SHA

The role openstack-ansible-security has been updated to fix several
bugs. This commit updates the version used by openstack-ansible to the
head of the liberty branch.

This commit switches from using a tag to using a SHA to allow future
updates of the version consumed to be done as part of the standard
release process by which all other SHAs are updated.

Change-Id: I812aa3642a7f62761a70006a4e5d312f4b7bad2c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/15/318715/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Complete Nova support for Glance's v2

Glance v1 is subject to deprecation, we need Nova to move away
from v1 and use v2 fully. This spec discusses how we plan to
make that transition. This also documents the testing plan
for both v1 and v2 and few limitations associated with it.

Previously-approved: Mitaka

Change-Id: I1247b436f9cbb21eb6e3d5cbabe5345e6037ceb2
Co-authored-by: Flavio Percoco <flaper87@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Sudipta Biswas <sbiswas7@in.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Reword the note following microversion headers

I had to read the original note four times before it made sense to me.
The problem, I think, was that it talked about 'old' and 'new' - but I
don't have enough context to immediately remember which is old and which
is new. Also, the new thing was first, and my brain wanted to make them
be listed in the opposite order. It was also unclear to me for a bit
which was the one I was supposed to use.

Address those concerns by rewording the note to be clear that the first
option is the desired one, and to refer to each of them as first and
second rather than old and new.

Change-Id: I1d51572eb57278e6b21224ca60516c528de42ee1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-sig refs/changes/71/312971/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: The first header is the recommended form. The second header is in the form of a microversion header currently in use. It effectively demonstrates the problem. Also note that whereas the second header uses a service name the first header uses the more correct service type.
deleted_lines: .. note:: The second header is in the form of a microversion header currently in use. It effectively demonstrates the problem. Also note that whereas the older header uses a service name the newer header uses the more correct service type.

commit_message:
Nailgun Fixes for smart configuration changes support

Simply unhardcode the handler for $.configuration namespace
to allow a user to modify anything he wants in this namespace.
The list of modifyable sections on '$.configuration' namespace of astute.yaml
should not be hardcoded - this makes no sense as support of these pieces
is implemented on fuel library and plugins side. Hardcoding the list
will make it impossible for a plugin developer to reuse configuration
changes feature to support configuration options for plugin.

DocImpact

Partial-bug: #1580522

Change-Id: I4eb18461c0a4f337b649abfcd099259965290ff5

commit_message:
Provide package update and toggle_public with glance_client

Due to the changes in client for maintaining visibility
consistency between packages and images we need to pass glance
client to update and toggle_public method calls.
Also this patch adds warning for the user that other packages
will also become public.

Change-Id: I0c95bc0abf6e597f4dd6934ae423e0f8111c3cc5
Depends-on: I7b673c40595ce730b5da83877279ee70ac37924b
Partial-bug: #1509208
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/51/310251/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: glance_client = glance.glanceclient(self.request, version='1') murano_client.packages.update(dep_pkg.id, dep_data, glance_client=glance_client) murano_client.packages.update(app_id, data, glance_client=glance_client)
deleted_lines: murano_client.packages.update(dep_pkg.id, dep_data) glance_client = glance.glanceclient(self.request, version='1') murano_client.packages.update(app_id, data)

subject: Maintain visibility consistency for packages and images
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-26 11:09:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient/commit/6847842f3f6a9286f2e6b800f372dcb03cd67f02', 'message': 'Maintain visibility consistency for packages

This change adds code that ensures that if package is made public,
all its dependencies (required packages) are also made public.
It allows to avoid bad user experience for a tenant having access
to a package but not to its dependencies in case of turning
private packages into public.
Change is made in muranoclient to provide the same behaviour while
changing package visibility through dashboard or through CLI.

Change-Id: I7b673c40595ce730b5da83877279ee70ac37924b
Partial-bug: #1509208
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-26 16:48:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient/commit/d388195bb44e0facf4d3b7e1bd94ba88910ad694', 'message': 'Maintain visibility consistency for packages and images

This change adds code that ensures that if package is made public,
all its dependencies (required packages and images) are also made
public. It allows to avoid bad user experience for a tenant having
access to a package but not to its dependencies in case of turning
private packages into public.

commit_message:
Maintain visibility consistency for packages and images

This change adds code that ensures that if package is made public,
all its dependencies (required packages and images) are also made
public. It allows to avoid bad user experience for a tenant having
access to a package but not to its dependencies in case of turning
private packages into public.
Change is made in muranoclient to provide the same behaviour while
changing package visibility through dashboard or through CLI.

Change-Id: I7b673c40595ce730b5da83877279ee70ac37924b
Partial-bug: #1509208

added_lines: from muranoclient.common import utils if key == 'is_public' and value is True: self._make_reqs_public(app_id) else: data.append({'op': operation, 'path': '/' + key, 'value': value}) def _make_public(self, app_id): 'value': True}] def _make_private(self, app_id): url = '/v1/catalog/packages/{0}'.format(app_id) data = [{'op': 'replace', 'path': '/is_public', 'value': False}] return self.api.json_patch_request(url, body=data) def _make_reqs_public(self, app_id): reqs = utils.Package.req_ids(app_id, self) for req_id in reqs: is_public = self.get(req_id).is_public if not is_public: self._make_public(req_id) def toggle_public(self, app_id): is_public = self.get(app_id).is_public if is_public: self._make_private(app_id) else: self._make_reqs_public(app_id)
deleted_lines: data.append({'op': operation, 'path': '/' + key, 'value': value}) def toggle_public(self, app_id): is_public = self.get(app_id).is_public 'value': not is_public}]

commit_message:
Align the stars to bump CI to latest Newton

1) scenario001: disable ceilometer tests on Ubuntu
Because we need this backport in UCA:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/318503/
And we won't have it before... who knows?
Let's disable the tests for Ceilometer on Ubuntu until UCA provides a
packaging update.
Let's also disable Telemetry at all on Ubuntu, since Ceilometer can't be
tested until UCA does the backport.

2) add RDO Newton dependencies repository, so we have paramiko >= 2.0
and have a more stable gate.

3) Update RDO trunk URL to have a very recent URL.

4) Update nova endpoints to match with what is required upstream (2.1)

5) Un-pin Tempest, so we keep testing master (our desire in our master
gate but we pin it in stable branches).

Change-Id: I10dc1beeca3ec47fd4c3a866aa3e1d3bc9d0aa81

commit_message:
Search Syntax Directive

Coverts the search syntax "?" link to a directive.

This is a part of a series of related, but independent patches that
pave the way to allow the searchlight-ui to use data-binding when
communicating with magic-search.

Change-Id: I9b7c29e7eddfb0b0186d80e2a4d2013b79bae004
Implements: blueprint data-binding-over-events

when boot process of provisioned node haven't completed.

hang.

So let's reboot immediately if we're in a bootstrap. Wait until
system boots completely in case of provisioned node. We check it by

commit_message:
wait until node boot completely before reboot

Reboot hook is used to reboot node with bootstrap image
or provisioned node. It's possible that this hook is called
when boot process of provisioned node haven't completed.
Upstart system doesn't handle such situation and node may
hang.

So let's reboot immediately if we're in a bootstrap. Wait until
system boots completely in case of provisioned node. We check it by
existense of /run/cloud-init/status.json (it's located on tmpfs, so
no stale file from previous boot can be found). If this file hasn't
appeared after 60 seconds - reboot as is.

Partial-Bug: #1573105

Change-Id: Iae113425a0034bc137c88db305d405f79807a5dc
(cherry picked from commit 4698918d4e08dbdddc31dda2c2a0a4c71f572aa2)

commit_message:
test heat-translator with master branch of tosca-parser

in an effort to maintain backward compatibility, it was decided
that heat-translator should test against the master branch of
tosca-parser. simply running the py27 job should be sufficient.

create a new tox entry that installs the latest master version
of tosca-parser, we should also add a job that runs this tox
entry.

i used [1] for inspiration.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/master/jenkins/scripts/run-tox-with-oslo-master.sh

Change-Id: I22c3d9330c92aa4d29d65b4a5405b90e716b5f77

Adding fields in the title to the block device mapping object

commit_message:
objects: adding serial, path, bus_address fields to bdm object

Adding fields serial, path, bus_address in the title to the
block device mapping object to be able to form disk metadata.

path - Holds a fix disk path, when used in a container.
serial - user-set serial disk serial string
bus_address - The block device's address as it appears to the guest.
              The format is based on the bus, can be any of the following:
              PCI address, or SCSI address, of USB port, or IDE channel, etc.

Partially implements blueprint virt-device-role-tagging
Co-authored-by: Artom Lifshitz <alifshit@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7a9902c4a96f98332678068ae53d09b6bd6b06d0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/17/310617/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
DB: add bus and bus_address to virtual interfaces

This patch contains the database migration to add bus
and bus_address columns to a virtual_interface table.
Together with the 'tag', these fields are needed to form
virtual_interface metadata.

Partially implements: blueprint virt-device-role-tagging
Co-authored-by: Artom Lifshitz <alifshit@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic4318cb4755eb159e16ce2db08045bcf5c94ce28
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/16/310616/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: bus = Column(String(36)) # physical address of device domain:bus:slot.func (0000:09:01.1) bus_address = Column(String(25))

commit_message:
DB: add path, serial and address to block devices

This patch contains the database migration to add serial,
path and bus_address columns to block_device_mapping table.
Together with the 'tag', these fields are needed to form
disk's metadata.

Partially implements: blueprint virt-device-role-tagging
Co-authored-by: Artom Lifshitz <alifshit@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I3f151247097b6294ff81cacd47b2aa0d5e556b86
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/15/310615/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: serial = Column(String(255)) path = Column(String(255)) # physical address of device domain:bus:slot.func (0000:09:01.1) bus_address = Column(String(25))
